tr.td: Statute 13 & 14 Car. II. c. 20. revived and continued for Seven Years, &c.

For the better Discipline of their Majesties Navy Royal for Three Years, &c.
See Ships.
For the better Admeasurement of Keels and Keel Boats in the Port of Newcastle, &c.
Commissioners to be appointed from time to time for marking Keels, &c.

Admeasurement how and where to be made.
See further 11 G.II.c. 15. § 8.— Weight and Contents of Wains and Carts of Coals regulated.
Commissioners to give Three Days' Notice of Time and Place of Admeasurement.
Keels, &c. to be marked and nailed.
Wains and Carts to be marked and nailed.
Persons appointed to mark, &c. to take an Oath.
Owners neglecting, &c. to have Keels, &c. admeasured—Penalty.
Regulation as to Time and Place of such admeasuring, marking, and nailing.
Keels, Wains, &c. carrying Coals before they are marked and nailed, unless by Default of Commissioners, forfeited, together with the Coals therein.
Removing or altering the Marks on Keels, Wains, &c. —Penalty £10—Distress—If no sufficient Distress, Imprisonment in Common Gaol for Three Months—How Penalty applied.

Such Keels, Wains, &c. remeasured, marked, and nailed.
The Method of admeasuring Keels, as by this Act, not altered, 13 G.III.c. 74. § 2. Further Regulations as to measuring and marking, 15G. III. c. 27. and as to altering and removing Marks, 31 G. III. c. 36. § 1

entry.head: New Rider Company See London, City of
Non-juring Clergymen See Daths of Supremacy and Allegiance.

tr.td:
Statutes 13 & 14 Car. II. c. 22. —18 Car. II. c. 3. —29 & 30 Car. II. c. 2. revived for 11 Years, &c.
State. 18 C.II.c. 3. and 29 & 30 C.II.c. 2. revived and continued until 1st Sept. 1744 by 6 G.II.c. 37. § 9. which, together with 13 & 14 C. II. c.22. is made perpetual by 31 G.II.c.42. § 1.
